definition: copious/plentiful (of water)/surging (of waves)/refers to home village of first Han emperor 漢高祖|汉高祖[Han4 Gao1 zu3]/fig. majestic

sentences.english: She had so much, earth could not claim the whole.
sentences.chinese: 她擁有豐沛，地獄也無法剎那褫奪她整個生命。

sentences.english: The fresh air is sometimes humid from the abundant rainfall of this area.
sentences.chinese: 清新的空氣有時會因這地區豐沛的降雨而潮溼。

sentences.english: Such is rather a time when the utterance is thick with emotion.
sentences.chinese: 倒不如說，那個時候是豐沛情感的吐露。

sentences.english: But the twigs stirred and plentifully showered dew that made me wet.
sentences.chinese: 但這嫩枝搖晃著，豐沛地灑下了露水，淋溼了我全身。

sentences.english: The current of the Ili is the most powerful of all of Xinjiang's rivers.
sentences.chinese: 伊犁河是新疆水流量最豐沛的河流。

definition: thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
a steady flow (idiom); an unending stream
to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
continuous (esp. of mountain ranges)/to stretch long and unbroken/a continuous link/sostenuto (sustained, in music)
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
